Wamenag Tak Masalah Dikritik DPR Soal Pelarangan Cadar
03 Nov 2019, 10:12 by , https://www.facebook.com/CNNIndonesia


Wamenag Zainut Tauhid Saadi tak mempermasalahkan pihaknya dikritik Komisi VIII DPR RI soal rencana pelarangan penggunaan cadar dan celana cingkrang.(ANTARA FOTO/Akbar Nugroho Gumay)

Jakarta, CNN Indonesia -- Wakil Menteri Agama (Menag) Zainut Tauhid Saadi tak mempermasalahkan pihaknya dikritik Komisi VIII DPR RI soal rencana pelarangan penggunaan cadar dan celana cingkrang di wilayah instansi pemerintah.Zainut meminta komisi DPR yang mengurusi agama itu untuk berprasangka baik terhadap rencana Kemenag. Sebab aturan pembatasan cadar dan celana cingkrang masih dalam kajian."Di era demokrasi sekarang ini, kritik disampaikan, boleh penolakan ataupun bentuknya, yang penting kita mengembangkan, pemahaman 'husnu tafahum' pemahaman yang positif terhadap langkah-langkah yang kita kerjakan," kata Zainut saat ditemui pada HUT ke-55 Tahun Parisadha Buddha Dharma Niciren Syosyu Indonesia (NSI) di Kantor Kementerian Agama, Jakarta, Minggu (3/11).Menurut Zainut pengaturan cara berpakaian untuk ASN adalah hal biasa. Bahkan sudah ada beberapa peraturan tingkat kementerian yang mengatur bagaimana para abdi negara berpakaian di kesempatan yang berbeda-beda.Dalam kesempatan itu, Zainut juga menjawab kegusaran DPR soal ambisi Kemenag memerangi radikalisme di bawah Menag Fachrul Razi. Zainut berujar tak ada satu pun kelompok di Indonesia yang tidak setuju dengan sikap Kemenag menangkal radikalisme.Wakil Ketua Majelis Ulama Indonesia itu juga mengajak Komisi VIII DPR untuk bersama-sama memerangi radikalisme yang sering kali berbalut agama."Kita semua harus bersama-sama untuk menolak paham radikal. Karena apa paham radikal ini merupakan bibit-bibit intoleran, bibit-bibit ekstrimisme, dan bibit-bibit terorisme," ucap Zainut.Sebelumnya, Ketua Komisi VIII DPR RI Yandri Susanto menilai pernyataan Menteri Agama Fachrul Razi yang menyinggung penggunaan niqab atau cadar dan celana cingkrang telah menimbulkan kegaduhan. Menurutnya, penganut paham radikal tak bisa hanya dilihat atau dinilai dari cara berpakaian saja."Ada orang pakai celana rapi, (bergaya) milenial bisa juga menembak seperti di Selandia Baru. Artinya, pernyataan Menag terburu-buru tergesa-gesa dan cenderung bikin gaduh," ucap Yandri kepada wartawan di Kompleks Parlemen, Senayan, Jakarta pada Kamis (31/10).(dhf/chs)

The Deputy Minister of Religion Is Not A Problem Criticized By The Parliament Regarding The Veil Ban
03 Nov 2019, 10:12 AM by, https://www.facebook.com/CNNIndonesia


Deputy Minister of Defense Zainut Tauhid Saadi did not make an issue of criticism from the House of Representatives Commission VIII's criticism regarding the plan to ban the use of veils and trousers. (ANTARA PHOTO / Akbar Nugroho Gumay)

Jakarta, CNN Indonesia - Deputy Minister of Religion (Menag) Zainut Tauhid Saadi has no problem with his party being criticized by the House of Representatives Commission VIII about the plan to ban the use of veils and green pants in the area of government agencies. Zainut asked the DPR commission which deals with religion to prejudice the Ministry of Religion's plan . Because the rules of limiting veils and trousers are still being studied. "In the current era of democracy, criticism is conveyed, it may be rejection or form, as long as we develop, understanding 'husnu tafahum' a positive understanding of the steps we are doing," said Zainut when met at the 55th Anniversary of Parisadha Buddha Dharma Niciren Syosyu Indonesia (NSI) at the Office of the Ministry of Religion, Jakarta, Sunday (3/11). According to Zainut the arrangement of how to dress for ASN is common. In fact there are already a number of ministerial-level regulations governing how servants of the state dress in different opportunities. On that occasion, Zainut also answered the DPR's anger over the ambition of the Ministry of Religion to fight radicalism under Minister of Religion Fachrul Razi. Zainut said there was not a single group in Indonesia that disagreed with the attitude of the Ministry of Religion to counter radicalism. The Deputy Chairperson of the Indonesian Ulema Council also invited Commission VIII of the House of Representatives to jointly fight radicalism which is often clad in religion. "We all must together to reject "Because radicalism is the seeds of intolerance, seeds of extremism, and seeds of terrorism," said Zainut. and short pants have caused a stir. According to him, adherents of radicalism cannot only be seen or judged by the way they dress. "There are people wearing neat pants, (stylish) millennials can also shoot like in New Zealand. That is, the statement of the Minister of Religion is in a hurry and tends to make noise, "Yandri told reporters at the Parliament Complex, Senayan, Jakarta on Thursday (31/10). (dhf / chs)
